org.dgfoundation.amp.newreports

Class ReportSpecificationImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.newreports.ReportSpecificationImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ReportSpecification

    public class ReportSpecificationImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReportSpecification
    Stores a report configuration by implementing ReportSpecification and defines all data required to generate a report.

      • getColumns

        public java.util.Set<ReportColumn> getColumns()
        Description copied from interface: ReportSpecification
        the names should NOT be localized
        Specified by:
        getColumns in interface ReportSpecification
        Returns:
        the set of columns to use. The order of iteration of the set is meaningful - so please either use a @link LinkedHashSet or a @link SortedSet

      • setColumns

        public void setColumns(java.util.Set<ReportColumn> cols)

      • addColumn

        public ReportSpecificationImpl addColumn(ReportColumn column)
        Adds a column to the columns set. Order is important, i.e. first column added will be the first one displayed. Refer to getColumns() for more details
        Parameters:
        column - - ReportColumn
        Returns:
        itself for chaining

      • getMeasures

        public java.util.Set<ReportMeasure> getMeasures()
        Specified by:
        getMeasures in interface ReportSpecification
        Returns:
        the set of measures to use. The order of iteration of the set is meaningful - so please either use a @link LinkedHashSet or a @link SortedSet

      • addMeasure

        public void addMeasure(ReportMeasure measure)
        Adds a measure to the measure list. Order is important, i.e. first measure added will be the first one displayed. Refer to getMeasures() for more details
        Parameters:
        measure - - ReportMeasure

      • getHierarchies

        public java.util.Set<ReportColumn> getHierarchies()
        Description copied from interface: ReportSpecification
        this set should be a strict subset of the one returned at ReportSpecification.getColumns()
        Specified by:
        getHierarchies in interface ReportSpecification
        Returns:

      • setHierarchies

        public void setHierarchies(java.util.Set<ReportColumn> hierarchies)
        Configures which columns are hierarchies to group data by. Any data starting from the 2nd non-hierarchical column is merged up for the group associated to the 1st non-hierarchical column and are not displayed in a separate row (titles are concatenated in a single row).
        Parameters:
        hierarchies -

      • getInvisibleHierarchies

        public java.util.Set<ReportColumn> getInvisibleHierarchies()
        Description copied from interface: ReportSpecification
        List of hierarchies that must be added before executing the report and then removed from output.
        Specified by:
        getInvisibleHierarchies in interface ReportSpecification
